column3: exactly. I know people who’ve had their homes broken into because they were doxxed. We shouldn’t be using that word lightly.

column1: Whether we should be tracking down the source of an ad is up for debate
column2: for sure. But it ain’t doxxing."

column3: that’s a totally different kettle of fish.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-10 08:07:06+00:00; ;1513066024718979075;en;0;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@JoMercerTherapy @aclientfirst I understand that. But Person First suggests that whatever you’re describing makes them less human. Or that it’s negative. I’m a Person With Endometriosis. I Live With Endometriosis. It doesn’t define me. But autism is everything we are.

column1: If you’re judging other autistic people based on what you THINK their life must be like

column1: We have to fight enough NTs without fighting each other."

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-09 20:35:59+00:00; ;1512892099745796096;en;731;2;10;108;Twitter for iPhone;"If you’re dismissing
column3: invalidating and attacking “low support needs autistics”
column4: just be honest and say you still believe in “functioning” labels but only when it suits you.

column1: Nobody has any idea what a stranger is going through
column2: and especially not via social media."

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-05 17:32:55+00:00; ;1511396478039826442;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@MsRobinHosking Internalising the world’s view of us is a huge problem
column3: but it *is* learned - we’ve just not remembered it
column4: because it starts so young. Children don’t invalidate themselves: they learn to because of other people.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-05 17:28:12+00:00; ;1511395292935032836;en;4;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@MsRobinHosking I’d argue we learn not to trust ourselves because of how others teach us to see ourselves. column3: it’s learned behaviour.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-05 17:24:15+00:00; ;1511394298201317383;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@TimClarePoet Sure
column3: I get that. Honestly

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-05 17:18:45+00:00; ;1511392914399768581;en;5;0;2;0;Twitter for iPhone;@mattsibleycopy @KirstyLouiseMo1 @aheeleyRIBA Autism also isn’t a communication disorder
column3: which is what she’s got it down as. That’s a tiny part of our wiring - a difference in comm style - and only matters to NTs because it impacts on THEM.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-05 17:17:26+00:00; ;1511392581757898753;en;64;0;2;6;Twitter for iPhone;"So NTs - please think twice before you make a little white lie
column3: one that seems no big deal. It is to us.

column1: And my autistic neurokin: try to trust yourself
column2: your instincts
column3: your memory. Don’t let others erase it for you.

column1: Gaslighting is way more dangerous than it might seem.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-05 17:17:26+00:00; ;1511392580357009411;en;43;0;1;3;Twitter for iPhone;"And the REALLY fun bit?

column1: When an NT gaslights an autistic person
column2: they will often blame the discrepancy on our neurology. We got it wrong *because* we are autistic. They use our wiring both as a shield AND a weapon.

column1: It’s so common it was actually part of my diagnosis. -8"

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-05 17:17:25+00:00; ;1511392579102953483;en;31;0;1;1;Twitter for iPhone;"And the consequences are far reaching.

column1: Not knowing quite what the reality is doesn’t just leave you susceptible to abuse: it also impacts mental health in a massive way. In a rewiring your personality kind of way. In a difficult to recover from kind of way. -7"

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-05 17:17:25+00:00; ;1511392577815289870;en;32;0;1;2;Twitter for iPhone;"This works with tiny lies
column3: right up to huge ones. It destabilises us
column4: and over time we lose sense of ourselves.

column1: It’s ONE of the multiple reasons why autistic people are so vulnerable to abuse - because we can be more vulnerable to gaslighting
column2: especially over time.-6"

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-05 17:17:25+00:00; ;1511392575919435782;en;47;0;1;2;Twitter for iPhone;"And why is this SO DANGEROUS?

column1: Because it means we slowly lose our ability to trust ourselves
column2: our memories or our instincts. We become easier to manipulate.

column1: We slowly begin to think we’re crazy. That we understand a lot less than we actually do.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-05 17:17:24+00:00; ;1511392574564675591;en;37;0;1;2;Twitter for iPhone;"We can also be extremely trusting. Not all of us - some of us have learnt not to be - but because we are honest
column3: we expect others to be too.

column2: we often don’t see it. If someone GASLIGHTS
column3: it can work.

column1: We doubt our own reality. We blame ourselves again. -4"

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-05 17:17:24+00:00; ;1511392573302132741;en;36;0;1;3;Twitter for iPhone;"This leaves us vulnerable
column3: because we’re often unsure what is actually going on
column4: and what “the truth” is (NTs are less candid in communication).

column1: So when someone tells us we misunderstood
column2: or got it wrong
column3: or misread the situation
column4: we tend to believe them.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-05 17:17:24+00:00; ;1511392571792240641;en;38;2;1;4;Twitter for iPhone;"Autistic people spend a lot of their time trying to understand NT communication. It’s exhausting. We frequently get it wrong. We are used to apologising and blaming ourselves.

column1: This is (not always but) often our default state.
We are also used to being punished for it. -3"

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-05 17:17:23+00:00; ;1511392570290675715;en;33;1;1;3;Twitter for iPhone;"(To clarify
column3: we’re not talking about “difference of opinions”
column4: we’re talking about the definition of gaslighting: consciously manipulating the truth
column5: for your own gain.)

column1: Gaslighting happens to autistic people ALL THE TIME.

column2: and why does it matter?-2"

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-05 17:17:23+00:00; ;1511392568248049669;en;57;1;3;19;Twitter for iPhone;"The GASLIGHTING that goes on between NTs and autistics is a real problem.
who here is autistic and has been gaslit? Ie - told something didn’t happen when it tangibly did
column3: or visa versa? /1"

You were simply explaining. I was just saying why identity and person first language have big differences. I *have* endometriosis - that’s something I live with. But autistic is something I am. 💕

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-04 08:29:17+00:00; ;1510897280945115136;en;5;0;2;0;Twitter for iPhone;@metalisko @JoMercerTherapy @aclientfirst But Autistic people aren’t living with lifelong conditions. Our neurology is autistic
column3: which means it’s how we’re built. It’s the difference between chocolate ice cream and ice cream with chocolate. Not a condition.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-03 16:52:37+00:00; ;1510661559005155335;en;4;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@Nathansnowbooks @isntJen Also

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. column3: while pretending they’re not just using functioning labels again. As if anyone can tell what a strangers support needs are.

column3: and believe me - the urge to try and insist on our “humanness” is still there when people can be so cruel. But essentially the fight is to make people see our neurology is different but equal
column4: instead of worse or lesser. Xx

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-02 22:15:29+00:00; ;1510380426828951553;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@LadyDoctorSays This better not happen to me - I am NOT going through another day fending for myself.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-02 22:09:56+00:00; ;1510379030327005185;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@stasie3 @BorisJohnson It’s essentially the equivalent of describing someone as “person with femaleness”
column3: “person with blackness”
column4: “person with gayness”. That’s how nonsensical it is. Every part of us is autistic. Brain and body. We are not “a person first” because we don’t need to be.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-02 22:07:44+00:00; ;1510378473998716939;en;1;0;2;0;Twitter for iPhone;@stasie3 @BorisJohnson It’s multi-faceted. A) Autism is neurology - it’s how you’re wired
column3: in your entirety. There is no “you” without it - so it’s an identity. B) autism is not bad. It’s not a disease
column4: to be removed/cured. C) Saying we are “a person first” indicates that autism makes us non-human.

Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-02 11:34:06+00:00; ;1510219014987042817;en;4;0;1;1;Twitter for iPhone;@autistamatic @Greg38589422 @ActivistHat_ It happens again at GCSE. My mum is autistic and became so overwhelmed by exams she failed and left school at 16. It took her until her 40s to return to education. So many forks in the road where NDs get forced out of the system.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-02 11:31:26+00:00; ;1510218342635872264;en;3;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@autistamatic @Greg38589422 @ActivistHat_ Absolutely. It’s infuriating. And
column3: as we’ve seen
column4: those measurements have consequences. They ruin lives. They restrict potential. They get NDs labelled and discarded. The entire system needs dismantling and rebuilding.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-02 11:25:31+00:00; ;1510216856858247176;en;3;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@Greg38589422 @ActivistHat_ @autistamatic Yes
column3: sorry I’m not being clear - it’s awareness week - I’m close to burn out. 😂 I mean WITHIN our own individual brains we have spikier profiles. Often we’ll be allocated a measurement based on the things we can’t do
column4: not the things we can.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-02 11:23:37+00:00; ;1510216376711102467;en;4;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@autistamatic @Greg38589422 @ActivistHat_ Yup. The physical conditions of the examination itself usually excludes ND people. Timing
column3: bright lights
column4: lots of people
column5: noise
column6: pressure. It’s a test to perform as NTs

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-02 11:20:13+00:00; ;1510215522419462148;en;3;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@autistamatic @Greg38589422 @ActivistHat_ Completely agree. I measure differently
column3: depending on the precise focus of the IQ test. They fail to measure ND brains because they’re based on NT profiles.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-02 11:18:21+00:00; ;1510215052514713601;en;6;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@aheeleyRIBA Can wait for the promised “more”. 😂

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-02 11:17:41+00:00; ;1510214882494488583;en;2;0;3;0;Twitter for iPhone;@Greg38589422 @ActivistHat_ @autistamatic By “fail” I mean “by NT standards be considered low IQ and therefore “severe/profound/low function” whatever they want to label it as. They are not designed to test ND brain profiles.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-02 11:13:01+00:00; ;1510213710526271491;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@ActivistHat_ @autistamatic @Greg38589422 Not even just that. You can be good at taking tests
column3: but if your skill set is very weak and very strong and an average is taken
column4: you could still end up failing an IQ test. It’s a flawed measurement system at best.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-02 11:10:46+00:00; ;1510213142260985859;en;6;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@autistamatic @Greg38589422 @ActivistHat_ It’s also the NT concept of “IQ” that attempts to make that divide. It doesn’t take into account the super spiky brain profiles of NDs
column3: and how you cannot take an average measurement that means *anything* if you’re not NT.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-02 11:07:08+00:00; ;1510212227713884167;en;5;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@autistamatic @Lau_Cob_ @Greg38589422 Mind blown. I guess that was my naive thinking - that we were moving AWAY from “severe/mild” dichotomy. But you’re right. People in power want that reinstated.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-02 11:05:41+00:00; ;1510211863858003969;en;1;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@rednaxella44 @aheeleyRIBA @UN I’m sorry you feel that way - it can be tough. Usually because of the world we live in
column3: rather than our neurology itself. But not every autistic person feels that way about it.

ND brains are spiky. That’s why IQ tests mean so little - they’re measuring based on an NT flat profile.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-30 17:45:58+00:00; ;1509225436965969925;en;8;0;1;1;Twitter for iPhone;@ChrisQuinn64 @bethhill2829 @maggiefay_ @BiscottiNicole @MrsHayesfam @WalterDGreason @Mrs_Gilchrist @DavidGeurin @ERobbPrincipal @ClareCampbell7 @DrMBEdmunds What you are insinuating is that autism is inherently negative. That we have to in some way see “round” it. That’s not the case. Our gifts come from autism. Our beauty comes from autism. It is not separate.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-30 16:43:38+00:00; ;1509209748977201158;en;10;0;1;1;Twitter for iPhone;@ChrisQuinn64 @bethhill2829 @maggiefay_ @BiscottiNicole @MrsHayesfam @WalterDGreason @Mrs_Gilchrist @DavidGeurin @ERobbPrincipal @ClareCampbell7 @DrMBEdmunds If you don’t “label” a child (you mean diagnose) then they get other labels. Like “stupid”. “Rude.” “Arrogant.” “Lazy.” “Weird.” “Broken.” A diagnosis is not a label. It’s labels you get when you don’t have one.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-30 14:26:51+00:00; ;1509175326815010826;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@oilpaintwitch @CJElijahKane @VancePayne13 @Imani_Barbarin To do that
column3: we need to make people aware of how and why people think or behave “differently”. And we cannot do that without knowledge
column4: education and understanding. It’s not labels. It’s a way of allowing those on the outskirts an identity
column5: empowerment and voice.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-30 14:22:49+00:00; ;1509174312246386688;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@oilpaintwitch @CJElijahKane @VancePayne13 @Imani_Barbarin Can you get behind the concept of wide discrimination against certain types of people
column3: based on how they function? Because that’s what happens. It’s the equivalent of feminism. We ultimately want equality - to get there
column4: we have to lift the voices of women.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-30 14:18:20+00:00; ;1509173184267960325;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@oilpaintwitch @CJElijahKane @VancePayne13 @Imani_Barbarin Hence the concept of neurodiversity. The ultimate aim is to get all brain types accepted
column3: but that cannot happen when the neurotypical brain is the default and everything else is othered.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-30 14:07:38+00:00; ;1509170490971152390;en;1;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@oilpaintwitch @CJElijahKane @VancePayne13 @Imani_Barbarin The entire world labels themselves constantly. “Mother.” “Writer.” “Doctor.” “Wife.” What is more a part of someone’s identity than the way they are neurologically wired? It feels like you’ve missed the point in a big way.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-30 12:31:00+00:00; ;1509146171104796674;en;2;0;2;0;Twitter for iPhone;@MsRobinHosking @aheeleyRIBA It also results in lack of diagnosis for those NDs who do not have LDs. Plus a lot of ND people learn visually
column3: and not just those with LDs. It’s complex and nuanced and it creates too broad a brush stroke.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-30 12:27:45+00:00; ;1509145353660030976;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@MsRobinHosking @aheeleyRIBA Yes. The attempt to educate the masses on LDs and also that autistic people do not necessarily have LDs is an uphill battle. Continuously grouping them together doesn’t help anyone and that data is unhelpful to both
column3: but that’s my opinion.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-30 12:18:18+00:00; ;1509142976781504516;en;4;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@aheeleyRIBA That is true. But I do feel that it continues to exacerbate the general belief that they’re one and the same thing.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-30 12:15:09+00:00; ;1509142181487026180;en;5;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@aheeleyRIBA I don’t understand why they continue to group learning disabilities and autism together. Neither is worse or better
column3: but it’s like collecting data on apples and beetroots.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-30 12:02:13+00:00; ;1509138929034969091;en;4;1;1;1;Twitter for iPhone;@TheBullyingDr Isn’t it madness? You’d think that embracing your neurology would make it easier to be yourself
column3: but we’re still wired to not want to upset people.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-30 10:11:50+00:00; ;1509111150683856902;en;15;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@marinamaral2 Too bloody right it isn’t. 🥰

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-30 09:43:59+00:00; ;1509104138948333570;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@LouiseTondeur Yup. Imagine telling a fourteen year old who started out on a council estate that her class meant she was incapable of making it as a writer. 😂

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-30 09:41:46+00:00; ;1509103581105995778;en;3;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@LouiseTondeur “People like us don’t make careers out of writing.”

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-30 09:21:37+00:00; ;1509098511454937093;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@nickTheWink @SvladCjelli42 But doesn’t Autistic Adjustment kind of suggest that we have to change ourselves to fit NTs? That’s the opposite of what we’re fighting for. We do that anyway.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-30 09:01:05+00:00; ;1509093343514566670;en;3;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@taperoo2k @Greg38589422 @VickiWistow @MxOolong @commaficionado Partly. I have an incredibly strong self-defence wiring
column3: which has saved my life more than once. But also… sometimes I just decide a person is not worth a single second of my time or energy.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-30 08:59:45+00:00; ;1509093009153040389;en;18;0;0;1;Twitter for iPhone;@Modestsam81 @OhLew_ @NxTangl @VancePayne13 @CJElijahKane @Imani_Barbarin We do not have “conditions”. We are not “living with” anything. Our entire neurology is autistic. Everything. It’s who we are. I am so sad for your son that you see his wiring as something that can be detached from him.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-30 08:57:36+00:00; ;1509092465889972227;en;2;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@OHooleyandTidow I see you guys!!!

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-30 07:47:27+00:00; ;1509074812706168833;en;16;0;3;1;Twitter for iPhone;@SvladCjelli42 I feel this way too about “acceptance”. Accept the things you can’t change etc. You try to “accept” a terminal illness. Not an autism diagnosis.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. They’re just dead to me. I think about them and something slams shut in me. Usually because I’ve reached my pain threshold.

They’re not in my linguistic wheelhouse. 😂

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-29 21:58:32+00:00; ;1508926610015203333;en;3;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@MindParadox I’d never try to be a “voice” but by definition of having a voice and using it there can be a lack of distinction.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-29 21:38:37+00:00; ;1508921594181308423;en;4;0;2;0;Twitter for iPhone;@_inthespincycle The autie “know it all” is not exactly a rarity. 😂 For me
column3: not knowing is so much harder.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-29 21:37:10+00:00; ;1508921230962962432;en;5;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@MxOolong @VickiWistow @taperoo2k @commaficionado Oh
column3: a lot. I’ve usually spent years dealing with BS before I hit that point. The issue is usually cumulative
column4: and that’s why it can’t be undone.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-29 21:31:29+00:00; ;1508919798788460545;en;5;0;3;0;Twitter for iPhone;@VickiWistow @MxOolong @taperoo2k @commaficionado That’s so interesting. I never forgive. Ever. My list is laminated and everything. 😂 Not doing much for the grudge-holding stereotype over here.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-29 21:28:29+00:00; ;1508919046493945859;en;18;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@_inthespincycle Even the *most* highly respected autistic academics are still learning. That’s what makes them special. It’s the NTs who think they’ve got autism down who are the problem.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-29 21:26:23+00:00; ;1508918515230810132;en;2;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@risatrix @MxOolong @commaficionado @taperoo2k Great quote. I’m tuned into that now
column3: with age. Lack of character is the gap between saying and doing
column4: and I no longer bother with anyone that falls into that category.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-24 15:20:48+00:00; ;1507014575807340559;en;437;0;10;59;Twitter for iPhone;"I can’t help but notice that the trauma vs autism argument tends to focus on women.

column1: Apparently men are entitled to a neurology
column2: but women are built in response to others. We are created by other people
column3: not whole by ourselves.

column2: again."

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-24 15:15:52+00:00; ;1507013333748117511;en;0;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@InnerVisioner My point is that most autistic people are traumatised
column3: by virtue of living in a world not built for them. The difference between a traumatised NT and a traumatised ND is an entire neurology. They are not the same thing. Our neurology is not inherently a trauma response.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-24 15:11:38+00:00; ;1507012268898205697;en;1;0;2;0;Twitter for iPhone;@InnerVisioner There is no POV. Neurology is neurology
column3: trauma is trauma. Do not undermine and eradicate my neurology by claiming who I am and how I am built is caused by the actions of others. It is offensive in the extreme.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-24 15:02:42+00:00; ;1507010022798024716;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@InnerVisioner You can find an “expert” to say anything
column3: especially regarding neurodivergency. They’re not the same thing and it is beyond offensive to argue they are.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. That’s it. They’re not the same thing. It’s very very easy for a professional to tell the difference. There’s no “nature or nurture” question here. One is born
column3: the other developed.

column2: guys. It’s party time. https://t.co/A9l9Iqqamg"

But it might be worth considering.

column3: depending on how your brain works
column4: it’s often way more productive to work for 16 hours straight and come back in a few days. Writing a few hours a day for me is totally unproductive.

column3: but if it helps I’m good at art. Cara Delevigne the supermodel is dyspraxic and she walks catwalks. I don’t think a talent or skill in anyway counts out a neurodivergency
column4: so it’s worth checking. Sounds like dyspraxia to me.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-22 10:15:13+00:00; ;1506212898934243335;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@Josh_Merritt1 This week. X

No. For diagnosis you need to have had clear symptoms in early childhood. Can it get worse? Age and tiredness and less muscle/more body disintegration can make symptoms worse
column3: I’d say.

Dyspraxia IS a learning difficulty. That’s it’s bloody definition. That is so frustrating for you.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. column3: even diagnosis gets you nothing at all so I don’t see how self dx makes a difference! 😂 But worth looking into if you want the diagnosis.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-22 09:37:33+00:00; ;1506203416447668224;en;3;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@MWilsonKimber @AutisticGothic Basically I think that all of the ND conditions are different manifestations of the same thing. I’m also hyperlexic and have dyscalculia
column3: I’m dyspraxic
column4: autistic and synesthetic. The arbitrary lines drawn are made by doctors and I think it’ll change with time.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. It’s those things that shocked me too. Sense of time too. Spatial orientation. Following directions. It’s super complicated.

column3: and also what I was being tested for in my dyspraxia assessment! 😂 There are some accounts on here so search for dyspraxia in Twitter - that might help?

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. column3: did yours? Can you show them? I have no more exams sadly - have mine. 😂

I do agree with you - dyspraxia appears to be the unsexy underdog of ND

column4: which doesn’t help.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 23:32:10+00:00; ;1506051070698610694;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@TigerLillieRead Maybe! Me too! I’m also hyper mobile so it’s a fab combo of basically trying to balance my bones on top of each other 24/7. 😂

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 23:31:24+00:00; ;1506050875483119625;en;12;0;0;1;Twitter for iPhone;@TigerLillieRead @ItsEmilyKaty Sadly diagnosis seems to come with literally zero advice
column3: help
column4: support
column5: information… For me
column6: they said “you’re dyspraxic” and kicked me into the ether. 😂

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 21:43:38+00:00; ;1506023755356807176;en;1;0;1;1;Twitter for iPhone;@neuro91171318 Honestly
column3: I think people confuse that a lot. An inability to write neatly or quickly is often assumed to be an inability to write
column4: when it’s a physical impediment. So it’s frequently misinterpreted in schools too.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 21:37:54+00:00; ;1506022312298295296;en;2;0;1;1;Twitter for iPhone;@neuro91171318 With regards to handwriting
column3: they mean the actual act of writing by hand - we have poor fine motor skills so it causes pain. That’s one of the key diagnostic criteria. Processing texts doesn’t mean reading - it can be processing the info or meaning
column4: especially quickly.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 21:28:50+00:00; ;1506020032048136192;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@neuro91171318 I’m hyperlexic too - dyspraxia has nothing to do with writing and reading skills
column3: that’s dyslexia and they’re totally separate neurodivergencies.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 21:28:12+00:00; ;1506019870529400833;en;6;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@Lau_Cob_ @AnLasair I didn’t say they were two different things. I was pointing out that only the external
column3: motion based are recognised by most people.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 21:27:28+00:00; ;1506019687179587589;en;3;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@Lau_Cob_ @AnLasair Yes
column3: I do appreciate that. But pretty much everything comes from the brain so i was attempting to distinguish between the outward attributes of dyspraxia that affect the body and the others.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 20:33:24+00:00; ;1506006082061320195;en;1;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@AjratYllek Interestingly it’s normally the other way round - usually the boys get picked up while the girls slip through! It’s not too late. You’re obviously very loving and will give him the support he needs. X

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 20:32:22+00:00; ;1506005820445798400;en;5;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@AzariahAnglican I’d like to understand more too! There’s a few on here
column3: but honestly there’s a complete absence of info
column4: support
column5: knowledge. I’m just picking up what I can where I can. As for advantages - creativity and problem solving?

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 20:29:36+00:00; ;1506005123423739920;en;4;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@AjratYllek No - how are you to blame? Unless you’re a trained professional in neurodivergencies
column3: how could you know? It’s not your fault. I don’t blame my parents for me getting to 40 without knowing. (Also my mum is both autistic and dyspraxic and didn’t know either!)

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 20:24:35+00:00; ;1506003860636196872;en;10;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@WomenOfAutism @DConwayRead @AutisticGirls_ They have no idea the crazy adaptations we’ve had to make to hide them. Often *we* forget. I cried in my assessment because I could no longer avoid doing things I have refused to do for decades.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 20:23:35+00:00; ;1506003611209375745;en;1;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@AjratYllek Clumsiness isn’t autism. Is that what you mean?

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 19:22:39+00:00; ;1505988277500792837;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@SarahMc66676848 That’s such an important point. And as I get older the more time I take
column3: the less I panic
column4: the better my answers and the more people actually listen. Everything doesn’t have to move so fast.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 19:21:49+00:00; ;1505988064996470788;en;2;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@EChickentender @Misty_Melanie Yes!! Health consequences
column3: education consequences
column4: mental health consequences
column5: the whole shebang. It’s not a one-size-fits-all - each needs to be taken into account.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 19:17:05+00:00; ;1505986874405498881;en;5;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@EChickentender @Misty_Melanie It’s mad. I see people say “I’m super clumsy but I’m autistic so…” or “I’m super bendy and my skin stretches but I’m autistic so…”. It’s not their fault - the info out there is dire.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 19:16:08+00:00; ;1505986635418251277;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@girlscouter @DyspraxicHelp4U It can be so helpful but it’s awful that this isn’t part of the general education system. X

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 19:15:21+00:00; ;1505986439116374026;en;2;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@girlscouter @DConwayRead @AutisticGirls_ I’ll expand tmrw
column3: but - I allocated 50% of exams to planning
column4: structuring and time management (written down). I wrote very little
column5: very slowly. I divided it into portions and gave myself hand breaks/massages. I cut my essay lengths by about three quarters.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 19:11:55+00:00; ;1505985575760842753;en;11;0;1;2;Twitter for iPhone;@girlscouter Honestly
column3: I am still working it out for myself. I think I’ll make a list
column4: but there are people like  @DyspraxicHelp4U who can be great. Go slow
column5: give extra time
column6: help to organise and structure. Write it all down. There are definitely ways to help - I’ll put them together. Xx

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 19:08:35+00:00; ;1505984737013374983;en;5;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@EChickentender @Misty_Melanie A lot of NDs have been told that “autism” is a catch all diagnosis that explains every part of them. It really isn’t.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 19:06:43+00:00; ;1505984267901358083;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@MSimmsNZ It’s not really heard of much here either. People see it as “bad at netball”.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 18:55:23+00:00; ;1505981413820149765;en;0;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@Becca_JF21 Tbh it was more mind blowing for me than my autism diagnosis. I actually got confused in my assessment because I was like “why are you testing my brain not my body”? I had no idea.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 18:53:12+00:00; ;1505980862931816450;en;7;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@EChickentender @Misty_Melanie Yes I’m seeing a lot of “it’s part of my autism” posts and it’s very much not always part of the autism. Neurodivergency is still in its infancy but they’re distinctly separate. I’d say it’s worth checking out.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 18:51:52+00:00; ;1505980526884229128;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@iamwildthoughts The constant struggle to “produce” even when no part of your brain is working is very real. 😖 I’m glad you napped too. Naps for all!

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 18:28:37+00:00; ;1505974678946553867;en;5;0;3;0;Twitter for iPhone;@ssousafineart @TaleSpinning I know - I made an official complaint. It was a toxic process and I won’t recommend them to anyone. But others will be great!

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 18:27:49+00:00; ;1505974477095645192;en;2;0;2;0;Twitter for iPhone;@ssousafineart @TaleSpinning My strategy is to tell them to sod off. I’m no longer at a point where I feel an obligation to justify my abilities or disabilities to anyone. 🥰

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 18:16:09+00:00; ;1505971540680187912;en;38;0;3;4;Twitter for iPhone;@meiriontodd Important to note that dyspraxia and autism are separate neurodivergencies. They can be comorbid (and frequently are) but they are not the same thing.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 18:15:21+00:00; ;1505971338753761280;en;29;0;3;2;Twitter for iPhone;@katie_books @robinince It definitely makes us more creative! And also problem solvers. When you have to find ways around simple tasks
column3: it makes you an extremely think-outside-the-boxer.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 18:14:39+00:00; ;1505971161460527104;en;4;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@alicelbright Yup
column3: that sounds about right. There’s a real mix up. Even educators think it’s “bad at netball” which is SO far from the truth. I didn’t know until I was actually half way through the assessment.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 18:13:47+00:00; ;1505970944359211011;en;9;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@GerryRush5 @Joannechocolat Yes and that seems to be common. There’s almost no support system in place. In the 80s and 90s it was a Lord of the Flies
column3: struggle to survive situation. 😂

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 18:08:06+00:00; ;1505969516542631940;en;17;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@WitchWoodIand @EChickentender Same. Although I can sometimes tell a difference between “know what I want to say and can’t physically get my tongue to work” and “brain says nope” which I feel is my dyspraxia and autism at war. 😂

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 18:06:41+00:00; ;1505969158051311626;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@TheFoxbeard 🤯🤯🤯 nice one
column3: doctor.

If you think about dyspraxia affecting fine motor abilities
column3: and how many you need to use your tongue and mouth
column4: even from a purely physical perspective it can impact. Not to mention the brain parts too.

Feel that. 😂

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 16:39:19+00:00; ;1505947171119583233;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@VelvetinaB I should have added THERAPY because it’s Monday. Forgiveness

column5: and I get angry about it
column6: 100 per cent of time. 😂

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 16:22:51+00:00; ;1505943026186821635;en;0;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@ESNYSOFIA My sister is ADHD and I’m autistic and we drive each other up the wall so yes - I’d imagine so. 😂

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 16:09:54+00:00; ;1505939768521236484;en;3;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@ESNYSOFIA I find the crossover between ADHD and autism really fascinating and have my own theories

column3: so my experience is literally the opposite. But yeah
column4: there’s a massive hole where knowledgeable professionals are supposed to be. 🤯

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 16:05:43+00:00; ;1505938715000152067;en;4;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@LindaGreenisms @alicelbright Yup. I got Ds in all my mocks. It was only when I came up for a strategy to counteract my “brain hurdles” (undiagnosed dyspraxia) that I came out with A*s.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 16:04:08+00:00; ;1505938319376621568;en;158;0;14;6;Twitter for iPhone;"Today
column3: during Neurodiversity Week
column4: I am giving myself permission to nap when I should be working instead of hating myself because I can’t function at the level I need to.

column1: So that’s how I’m celebrating ND week.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 15:56:08+00:00; ;1505936305087254536;en;7;0;2;0;Twitter for iPhone;@ESNYSOFIA Yes I have dyscalculia too. Even my dyspraxia psychologist didn’t know what it was. 🤯

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 15:50:32+00:00; ;1505934892739477507;en;6;0;2;0;Twitter for iPhone;@alicelbright @LindaGreenisms “Brightness” seems to get in the way of a lot of ND diagnosis
column3: which is a huge problem. It doesn’t matter how “bright” you are if your learning needs are not being met.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 15:29:48+00:00; ;1505929675469729806;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@BooksandChokers @drjenny88 Yup
column3: they are legion.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 15:01:09+00:00; ;1505922468485160967;en;6;0;2;0;Twitter for iPhone;@BooksandChokers @drjenny88 One year since official diagnosis because I spent 39 thinking it was another word for “clumsy”. 🤯 Hopefully it’s changing but I’m impatient.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 14:43:13+00:00; ;1505917955971985413;en;4;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@drjenny88 @BooksandChokers Yes! My own books also have a dyspraxic and autistic protagonist.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 14:42:41+00:00; ;1505917817803137030;en;6;0;1;1;Twitter for iPhone;@MandaMilan @DConwayRead @AutisticGirls_ It’s almost as if they think dyslexia is the only ND that impacts learning. Which is mind blowing
column3: but seems to be the common perception among general education.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 14:18:06+00:00; ;1505911632345579529;en;6;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@RosamundC For me that is my autism. X

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 13:24:05+00:00; ;1505898038564425728;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@ssousafineart @FtSpeechie Yes indeed!! 💕

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 13:23:44+00:00; ;1505897951872364553;en;3;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@DConwayRead @AutisticGirls_ But even the schooling itself can be altered for ND kids with enormous impact. I went from failing my exams to straight As and a postgrad degree
column3: literally just by adapting the way I approached homework/exams.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 13:22:36+00:00; ;1505897665950793735;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@ssousafineart @FtSpeechie Yes! Indeed! I don’t feel like my dyspraxia is JUDGED the way being autistic is
column3: but I also think people know even less about it. It carries less stigma but also way less understanding. Which has to change.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 13:17:41+00:00; ;1505896430703157259;en;2;0;2;0;Twitter for iPhone;@ssousafineart @FtSpeechie Cara Delevignine and Florence Welch too. It’s really the underdog of the neurodivergencies. The slapstick one. The banana peel of disabilities. 😂

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 13:02:56+00:00; ;1505892714965045253;en;3;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@Ali4128 They really are. Nobody has any idea the impact it has.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 12:38:44+00:00; ;1505886628119826435;en;37;0;2;2;Twitter for iPhone;@DConwayRead @AutisticGirls_ Yes
column3: and stop the assumption that everyone is neurotypical
column4: that there’s only one way to learn and if you don’t function “as per the majority” you don’t count and are useless. 🤯

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 12:34:25+00:00; ;1505885541501444102;en;1;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@ssousafineart Not at all
column3: but it does mean I don’t beat myself up as much (not mentally anyway). Instead of believing in stupid and ditzy and clumsy
column4: I’m learning to retrain my thought loops.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 12:33:31+00:00; ;1505885315843731464;en;3;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@ssousafineart Yup yup yup. I’ll plan to within an inch of my life
column3: still end up on the wrong train
column4: overwhelmed by noise and crying
column5: then have to explain why I’m late even though I left four hours early. 😅

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 12:30:17+00:00; ;1505884499086909440;en;24;0;3;0;Twitter for iPhone;@ssousafineart I mean
column3: all of that is true
column4: right?? Can’t walk straight. Broken toes. Bruises. Can’t pick up a pen. Drop my keys. But it’s the bit where I can’t follow basic instructions that gets me labelled as “stupid” or “lazy”. There needs to be more awareness.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 12:28:00+00:00; ;1505883926560219141;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@ssousafineart Yeah there’s a massive crossover. They sometimes make each other worse and sometimes help. I feel like autism steps in to help me plan and organise
column3: but when I’m tired it allllll gets impossible.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 12:27:14+00:00; ;1505883733064392705;en;50;0;6;0;Twitter for iPhone;@ssousafineart I agree completely. I’ve had people say “doesn’t that just mean you’re super clumsy?” And I believed them to the point of not seeking a diagnosis for FORTY YEARS
column3: despite being told I was as a child.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 12:20:28+00:00; ;1505882029493301249;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@MathewsAnnika @AnnaLouise6 Mine was roughly the same. Also be warned - mine was so difficult (literally) I bawled my eyes out. So it can be an emotional process!!

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 12:13:49+00:00; ;1505880357480054789;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;"@MathewsAnnika Yeah it’s difficult to untangle neurodivergencies all going on at once! My eyes don’t move together either
column3: and I’d imagine thats defo dyspraxia. But the pain I feel during eye contact? Autism. Dyspraxia can make us physically awkward; autism mentally awkward. 😂So fun!"

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 12:11:55+00:00; ;1505879878129889282;en;4;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@MayaOppenheim I am! Feel free to DM.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 12:07:22+00:00; ;1505878731872776192;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@tizzief People don’t think it’s important. It’s the slapstick neurodivergency. Like
column3: whoops
column4: there they go
column5: falling over again. Never mind failing exams.🤯

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 12:05:18+00:00; ;1505878213985247238;en;0;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@MathewsAnnika Mmmm
column3: this sounds like autism to me.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 11:59:48+00:00; ;1505876828606578690;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@tizzief This is brilliant. I’m sad to say I had to work this out on my own as a teenager
column3: and it was life changing. We just need support and strategies
column4: and then boom - potential unlocked.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 11:57:47+00:00; ;1505876320500264964;en;2;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@LynoSkyno Even I dismissed it as “clumsiness” for forty years until I realised the HUGE impact it had on everything else. If I hadn’t found ways to manage it on my own at school
column3: I’d have failed at 16 and dropped out of education.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 11:56:14+00:00; ;1505875930450964480;en;0;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@AnnaLouise6 Honestly
column3: my dyspraxia assessment was horrendous and I can’t recommend at all. I’d have a look online - there’s quite a few private options
column4: and it’s not as expensive as autism from what I can tell.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 11:52:50+00:00; ;1505875074640977928;en;0;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@AnonAutie It does!!

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 11:52:28+00:00; ;1505874982735433735;en;13;0;2;1;Twitter for iPhone;@AnnaLouise6 Nope
column3: I went private for both
column4: and separately (nearly a year between). From what I know
column5: dyspraxia is rarely diagnosed in adults and GPs are not that interested.

column3: as a super fun way of illustrating dyspraxia
column4: I made exactly the same point twice in two consecutive tweets
column5: because I’m dyspraxic and struggle to organise/structure my thoughts. 😂 https://t.co/2XhjWvNxmt

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 11:42:13+00:00; ;1505872401950728194;en;449;1;18;45;Twitter for iPhone;"With the right support and strategies
column3: there are proven
column4: clear ways to help dyspraxic adults and children live their best lives and fulfill their potential.

column2: WAY more than “clumsiness” is the first step to making sure we get them. /7"

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 11:42:12+00:00; ;1505872400784703491;en;414;0;1;42;Twitter for iPhone;"But it’s the unseen bits that make us fail exams. It’s the unseen bits that get us fired
column3: or demoted. It’s the unseen bits that can leave us labelled and pushed out of a system that doesn’t recognise us.

column1: So let’s stop talking about dyspraxia as “lack of motor function”. /6"

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 11:42:12+00:00; ;1505872398884737026;en;439;2;2;52;Twitter for iPhone;"And yes
column3: the physical element of dyspraxia is exhausting and debilitating. Just standing up straight requires energy and focus. Sports
column4: picking up a spoon
column5: tying a shoelace
column6: not walking into doors.

column1: Dyspraxic people spend SO much unseen energy
column2: just physically existing. /5"

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 11:42:12+00:00; ;1505872397622288384;en;434;4;1;54;Twitter for iPhone;"Dyspraxia also doesn’t impact intelligence
column3: but because it changes the WAY our brains work we need support to find other ways to function.

column1: Otherwise? We get labelled as lazy
column2: clumsy
column3: easily distracted
column4: stupid.

column2: but all of which can ruin lives. /4"

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-21 11:42:11+00:00; ;1505872396343029760;en;482;4;7;62;Twitter for iPhone;"It affects the ability to speak

column4: and write
column5: esp by hand. It affects map reading
column6: organisation

column1: All things you need to excel in school and at work.

column3: it’s because I’ve developed epic Twitter stage fright.

column1: Is anyone else going through social media shyness?

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-17 21:51:18+00:00; ;1504576132246654984;en;23;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@Galaxibrain @autienelle When I first realised
column3: I cried for about two weeks. But by the time I was diagnosed
column4: I was happy. I’d spent a lifetime thinking i was broken
column5: and now I understand why I function the way I do. But however you feel is ok.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. column3: find the things you can bury yourself in and take comfort there. It gets easier to with time. Xx

Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-23 13:36:48+00:00; ;1485245132677029891;en;116;1;3;6;Twitter for iPhone;"I’m adding that I’m *not* just talking about me - I’m talking about almost every ND creative I’ve discussed it with. We’ve ALL been there.

column1: The need to tell stories about neurodivergent people without us
column2: and then tell us “we’ve got one” is rampant across creative industries."

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-23 13:33:29+00:00; ;1485244296798388226;en;1;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@TimClarePoet Kind of. The world likes to put ND stories into ND boxes. “Oh we have an autism story.” No - you have ONE story with an autistic character. And worse when the majority of those “autistic stories” are made by NTs who find it untapped territory. 😂

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. column3: booting her out and then telling ND actors they “can’t act” without auditioning them.

column1: Our stories are co-opted for quirkiness and then we’re booted out of them because we’re not “capable”.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. column1: If people think autistic people can’t be creative
column2: it’s because we’re constantly being spoken over and for instead."

column2: acting

column4: telling *our* stories.

These girls will become women. The boys will become men. So all we’ve done is teach them - for the rest of their lives - that it’s the fault of the former for the actions of the latter.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. I’m interested in theories
column3: I have an academic background - why people get so vicious about me as a person I have no idea.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 19:11:14+00:00; ;1477719148079857669;en;3;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@AdSchaafsma I like Damian Milton’s theory of Double Empathy
column3: yes. I think it’s easier for humans to empathise with other humans of their own neurological type. That makes sense to me - we have shared experiences.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 19:06:34+00:00; ;1477717976027742212;en;2;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@nubbinsmcgee @turpywurpy God forbid we discuss interesting theories about our own brains
column3: huh?
