column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 18:53:40+00:00; ;1477714729992867843;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@leahmcelrath @commaficionado @LibDemStephen Yes
column3: that makes sense to me too. But as I said
column4: it’s just a theory that potentially gives us another way of thinking about both.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 18:50:57+00:00; ;1477714043603460104;en;3;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@leahmcelrath @commaficionado @LibDemStephen It’s just a theory - not even mine - and one that makes sense to me. But bloody hell
column3: the reaction of some people - no need for that level of animosity and personal attacks. I’ve just been accused of being in it “for the money”. 😂

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 18:45:09+00:00; ;1477712585441038347;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@SearlsDiane @commaficionado @LibDemStephen Yeah I’m super done with Twitter right now.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 18:44:32+00:00; ;1477712431677906949;en;3;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@LordBeardey @Division14STO @commaficionado @LibDemStephen WHAT MONEY. 😂 Like seriously
column3: what fucking money. I’m blocking people who are unnecessarily rude to me.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 18:43:12+00:00; ;1477712096309698564;en;8;0;1;1;Twitter for iPhone;@commaficionado @LibDemStephen I wouldn’t want a change. It’s right to have separate diagnosis
column3: for two totally different experiences. But it’s also okay to be questioning and exploring a connection
column4: especially when such a huge proportion of the community experience both.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 18:39:14+00:00; ;1477711095913750529;en;4;0;2;0;Twitter for iPhone;@commaficionado @LibDemStephen I don’t understand the anger or the rudeness. No change or conflation was being suggested. People are yelling at me and DMing me and subtweeting me and calling me names for suggesting a theory that already exists.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 18:32:33+00:00; ;1477709412814966795;en;1;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@BlueRaveFinn Yeah. I’m autistic
column3: my sister is ADHD
column4: but we have so much in common as well as so many differences. A common root neurology makes sense. But it’s a theory and I don’t understand the fury coming at me right now.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 18:31:29+00:00; ;1477709144597712899;en;0;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@theruckuz Yeah absolutely. It’s just a theory.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 18:29:50+00:00; ;1477708730632642560;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@nubbinsmcgee @turpywurpy There are obviously big differences but the theory takes that into account
column3: no?

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 18:29:24+00:00; ;1477708621110784012;en;4;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@commaficionado @LibDemStephen There are a LOT of differences. And also a lot of similarities. I guess what I’m saying is the theory explains that
column3: right? It does to me
column4: anyway. I do not understand why people are getting so angry about a theory.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 18:24:25+00:00; ;1477707366343004160;en;0;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@Division14STO Well yeah as I said. And this isn’t my theory
column3: to clarify. It’s an established one.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 18:23:50+00:00; ;1477707221647691778;en;6;0;0;1;Twitter for iPhone;@commaficionado @LibDemStephen Yeah I guess you could see monotropism as the neurological “parent” or either/or/both. I see ADHD traits in myself and autistic qualities in my ADHD sister
column3: yet we’re entirely different. I’d never argue to conflate them into one. I’m saying it’s maybe more complex than binary.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 18:22:29+00:00; ;1477706880172625925;en;3;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@LauraFMcConnell @LiamODellUK Yeah I’d never argue that. I am autistic
column3: my sister is ADHD - we have entirely different experiences and struggles. Those need to be identified and helped separately. But suggesting there’s a root genetic neurology that results in either/or/both shouldn’t result in outrage.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 18:17:13+00:00; ;1477705554722181126;en;8;1;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@LauraFMcConnell @LiamODellUK I’m the person Liam is subtweeting. I said I believed that it’s an interesting theory that autism and ADHD have the same *root neurology* of monotropism
column3: NOT that they are not distinct or different
column4: because they tangibly are.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 18:15:16+00:00; ;1477705065045626884;en;1;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@LauraFMcConnell @LiamODellUK That IS NOT what I have said. At all.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 18:13:26+00:00; ;1477704601730265091;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@Di_Eats_Toast I’m not saying we all identify as one or the other
column3: so it’s not binary. I’m saying that our individual monotropic brains are going to fall in what is identified as ADHD
column4: or autism
column5: or (very commonly) both.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 18:08:48+00:00; ;1477703437357928450;en;7;0;2;0;Twitter for iPhone;@ItsEmilyKaty @commaficionado @LibDemStephen I’m saying it’s the same ROOT neurology - monotropism. ADHD and autism are the two ends of it
column3: and VERY different. But I said that
column4: didn’t I? I’m not arguing to make them the same diagnosis. I’m saying to question and investigate their connections.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 18:07:20+00:00; ;1477703068166803458;en;7;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@commaficionado @LibDemStephen But the theory is it’s the *same see-saw*
column3: but with two different ends going in two different directions. And if you are in the middle (as many are) then you’re constantly tugged in both directions.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 18:05:24+00:00; ;1477702583296876548;en;4;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@commaficionado @SearlsDiane @LibDemStephen I know they’re very different - that’s what the theory is. They’re frequently pulling in opposite directions in one person
column3: hence the “clash”.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 18:04:17+00:00; ;1477702302190518277;en;2;0;2;0;Twitter for iPhone;@commaficionado @LibDemStephen I wouldn’t suggest that AT ALL. As you say
column3: they’re very different. Me as an autistic versus my sister as ADHD have totally different experiences and struggles. Doesn’t mean it isn’t coming from the same root
column4: but different expressions.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 18:03:01+00:00; ;1477701981955411968;en;2;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@commaficionado @LibDemStephen But I’d argue that the entire theory is in how different they are
column3: so I’m not sure I know what you mean. I didn’t suggest making them the same diagnosis. As I said - they’re very different. Like two ends of the same see-saw.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 18:00:33+00:00; ;1477701359722020868;en;3;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@commaficionado Okay! You’re allowed your opinion. I personally find it immensely helpful
column3: especially given the huge crossover for most of us and the conflicting directions it pulls us in.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 17:42:08+00:00; ;1477696724504354817;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@NDNeuroNews @ekverstania @charliclement_ @AutCollab Yes of course. X

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 17:31:56+00:00; ;1477694159582633986;en;1;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@taperoo2k @nubbinsmcgee I’ll have a look - thanks!

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 17:31:42+00:00; ;1477694100921008128;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@NDNeuroNews @ekverstania @charliclement_ @AutCollab We are all entitled to block
column3: mute and curate our own spaces
column4: without explanation. It’s boundaries
column5: and we’re all allowed them.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 17:25:40+00:00; ;1477692582369153024;en;0;0;2;0;Twitter for iPhone;@NDNeuroNews @ekverstania @charliclement_ @AutCollab Can you please not refer to me in third person when I can see the conversation?

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 17:23:20+00:00; ;1477691993295839237;en;2;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@nubbinsmcgee @turpywurpy Yeah
column3: they always do. I don’t care if people disagree - it’s a theory
column4: I have a background in academia
column5: disagreement is the nuts and bolts of progression. But his fucking TONE
column6: man. 🤯

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 17:16:02+00:00; ;1477690158212390912;en;0;1;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@nubbinsmcgee @turpywurpy But it still wouldn’t matter. Because how can you determine what percentage autistic versus what percentage ADHD someone is before scanning them? He’s missing the point entirely.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 17:15:12+00:00; ;1477689946756550659;en;0;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@nubbinsmcgee @turpywurpy This dude is fucking rude.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 16:48:08+00:00; ;1477683136280551430;en;1;1;2;0;Twitter for iPhone;@nubbinsmcgee Maybe. I’d be curious for it to at least be looked at/investigated. Arguably given that 60-70% of auties also have ADHD and visa versa
column3: the only people they’re *not* picking up are the small proportion who lean heavily on the one end and so lack the ADHD traits (like me).

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 16:46:37+00:00; ;1477682756297674761;en;1;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@shelleyxwallace Ahh they sound awesome. I’m still making flowers. 😂

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 16:45:04+00:00; ;1477682366298693633;en;1;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@Michael98724959 It’s not bloody easy to put into words in a tweet
column3: that’s for sure. 😂 I’m just asking questions basically. But apparently doing it poorly
column4: judging by the amount of people telling me I’m making no sense. 😂

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 16:42:31+00:00; ;1477681721579655169;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@Michael98724959 Yes they seem like better words to me
column3: although can I spell them? Probably not. 😂

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 16:41:55+00:00; ;1477681573298380808;en;5;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@AdSchaafsma No I don’t think so. Not least because autistic people don’t actually lack empathy. Autism isn’t a “fix” of ADHD
column3: or visa versa.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 15:59:36+00:00; ;1477670921284591621;en;5;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@jeffowens I’m the same. Not enough ADHD characteristics to qualify generally but at times I shift straight into ADHD mode. Depending on a myriad of factors.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 15:48:05+00:00; ;1477668022726840321;en;3;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@charliclement_ @NDNeuroNews Oh I totally think we do. There’s a lot of clash. But there needs to be space in the ND community for people to have theories and ask questions without people yelling and getting mean about it. Or why are we here?

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 15:44:38+00:00; ;1477667157983076359;en;0;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@taperoo2k @stuffysour Yes exactly. I dont have the words
column3: and I don’t have the diagram either. I have no doubt it wouldn’t *be* linear
column4: it would be a twisty 4D thing
column5: but I’m working with the tools I have.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 15:40:28+00:00; ;1477666107486056452;en;0;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@bewellstudiouk @turpywurpy Well yeah. I’d agree. Which is why I find it strange when people cite “dopamine” as being only ADHD. Essentially it’s all muddy and mixed up between autism and ADHD traits and the theory is why I think it *is* muddy and mixed up.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 15:39:12+00:00; ;1477665789536878596;en;4;0;2;0;Twitter for iPhone;@charliclement_ @NDNeuroNews Yes
column3: exactly. I’m fine with not being agreed with - there’s no evidence
column4: it’s a theory. What I have a problem with is being attacked for voicing thoughts about my own goddamn neurology. We are silenced by enough people as it is.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 15:38:03+00:00; ;1477665498372485120;en;3;1;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@NDNeuroNews @charliclement_ @ekverstania I intensely dislike this policing of thoughts and theories
column3: especially WITHIN the ND community. A majority of scientists aren’t asking questions because they’re mostly NT. So who the fuck is going to if not us?

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 15:36:19+00:00; ;1477665063381131271;en;4;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@bewellstudiouk Polytropic brains (NT) are able to filter and process multiple sources of input and output at the same time. ADHD/autism cannot. HOW we individually process differs depending on our own individual brains.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 15:35:14+00:00; ;1477664790948585477;en;0;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@bewellstudiouk I’m saying that monotropism doesn’t mean “singular thought”. It means “inability to process multiple sources of input and output”. That’s across the board
column3: for autism and ADHD. But we are all individuals with unique monotropic brains.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 15:34:08+00:00; ;1477664515626053635;en;0;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@bewellstudiouk @turpywurpy No I understand that. I’m saying that dopamine seems to have more involvement in ADHD but that doesn’t undermine the theory that people have individual monotropic needs. Which is why everyone responds differently to medication.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 15:32:31+00:00; ;1477664108464021505;en;2;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@bewellstudiouk It is all monotropism. ADHD and autism are both monotropism.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 15:30:50+00:00; ;1477663685397164045;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@steepsandstims No
column3: I don’t think you do. That’s okay! Let’s leave it there.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 15:30:27+00:00; ;1477663585291616257;en;0;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@bewellstudiouk @turpywurpy Yes
column3: although the same goes for autistic people.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 15:25:03+00:00; ;1477662229835259909;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@steepsandstims Same base neurology
column3: totally different expressions of it. And in many of us (60-70% I believe) it’s such a mixture that we have a dual diagnosis.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 15:23:31+00:00; ;1477661843166580741;en;0;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@taperoo2k @stuffysour Oh absolutely. They’re insufficient words
column3: overly simplified for the purpose of trying to get it into a tweet. I do not describe being autistic as “order”.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 15:22:33+00:00; ;1477661600588996612;en;6;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@steepsandstims 😂 But that’s exactly what I said. In the thread. I am autistic and not ADHD. My sister is ADHD and not autistic. We fall on either sides of that line
column3: hence get a single diagnosis because we present totally differently.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 15:21:31+00:00; ;1477661340475006982;en;3;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@bewellstudiouk Yeah I agree
column3: but that’s what I said
column4: right? I’m not talking about “focus” as in the act of focusing. I’m talking about it in terms of singularity. Ie - many versus few.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 15:15:33+00:00; ;1477659835843944453;en;1;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@NDNeuroNews @LiamODellUK @ekverstania We’re talking about linear not in terms of “severity” but in terms
column3: specifically here
column4: or two opposing forces at play in a monotropic brain. They are entirely different concepts. Conflating them is ridiculous.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 15:12:19+00:00; ;1477659023742836736;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@NDNeuroNews @LiamODellUK I don’t understand how suggesting an *already established theory* (ie not mine) between the possible link between two very commonly dual-experienced neurodivergencies can be *damaging*. Nobody’s removing identities. Nobody is casting aspersions. It’s a theory.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 15:09:21+00:00; ;1477658277093773315;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@FindingMyWayND Yeah it totally does. 😂 Honestly if I had the right type of brain thinking it would be some kind of four dimensional construct but I’m not capable of that kind of thing. 😂 It’s just a simplistic way of explaining that we’ve got those two opposing forces at play.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 15:07:16+00:00; ;1477657752243687427;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@NDNeuroNews @LiamODellUK I agree. If we cannot think and question and ponder our own neurodivergencies without being shut down
column3: it leaves us voiceless and powerless again. I’ve watched Liam do this to multiple ND accounts and it is not okay.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 15:03:03+00:00; ;1477656690346573833;en;0;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@turpywurpy I can’t be arsed to continue with this anymore. I think what I think. Go ahead and disagree.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 15:01:45+00:00; ;1477656364306546696;en;0;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@turpywurpy I don’t disagree that ADHD and dopamine are linked
column3: but both can be true. If - for example - the brain gets a hit of dopamine when monotropically hyperfocused
column4: it stands to reason that those who fall on the ADHD side need more of it.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 14:58:48+00:00; ;1477655623294726144;en;3;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@LiamODellUK Don’t micro manage the language I use and the thoughts I have
column3: Liam. I have said it’s a thought
column4: I’m not a scientist
column5: and we have to be able to open conversations.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 14:56:44+00:00; ;1477655102534176775;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@LiamODellUK I meant monotropic NDs and I think you know that
column3: given how many times I repeated it. Taking a line out of context when I’ve repeatedly said that I’m talking about monotropic brains not all neurodivergency is bad faith
column4: Liam.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 14:54:48+00:00; ;1477654614119911424;en;0;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@turpywurpy Not really
column3: because what I’m saying is that every monotropic person has a different brain with different activity and a different combination of both. Hence the line
column4: and not two separate circles.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 14:52:14+00:00; ;1477653967953960960;en;2;1;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@turpywurpy IMO
column3: the HUGE overlap not just in people diagnosed with both but in traits of both points to one divergency with opposing expressions
column4: resulting in infinite results.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 14:50:18+00:00; ;1477653481318227970;en;0;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@turpywurpy Why do you say that? I’d say that proves my point. Different parts of the brain are being affected depending on where you fall on that line. I’m not questioning the difference. My sister is ADHD and I am autistic - we are VERY different people.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 14:49:02+00:00; ;1477653162937012227;en;3;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@stuffysour (Also I’d argue that instead of a line it’s some crazy multi-dimensional shape that my brain is utterly unable to draw or imagine
column3: but which could be done by someone with a better science brain.) 😂

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 14:45:12+00:00; ;1477652197932511233;en;3;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@LordBeardey It’s controversial to be sure
column3: and I could have been more eloquent. And it’s all still pondering. But I can’t help feeling there is so much in it
column4: especially witnessing me (autistic) versus my sister (ADHD).

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 14:40:56+00:00; ;1477651125008543747;en;2;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@berberwalsh I’d imagine there’s some trauma thrown in there too. It’s all still very much to be studied.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 14:39:39+00:00; ;1477650804173590547;en;5;0;2;0;Twitter for iPhone;@stuffysour I think it’s important to add that my point was that our brain functioning is as valid
column3: as beautiful and as necessary as polytropic brains. I’m just trying to explain in a way that contextually uses language we all have had used to describe us.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 14:38:31+00:00; ;1477650517711106051;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@berberwalsh Yes
column3: absolutely agreed.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 14:37:52+00:00; ;1477650354808438785;en;0;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@turpywurpy And I’m responding to your response. 😂 I obviously knew people would disagree - as I said
column3: it’s controversial.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 14:37:19+00:00; ;1477650216622952454;en;3;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@stuffysour Both have negative connotations
column3: admittedly.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 14:36:01+00:00; ;1477649887189680136;en;4;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@turpywurpy You see
column3: that’s assuming “severity” of either. And generally that leads to “functioning” labels and that’s a no-no. Agreed it’s simplistic but I genuinely believe that our base neurology is the same.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 14:34:08+00:00; ;1477649414978105349;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@thebrainsports Yes
column3: anecdotally this is apparently very common. IMO it’s bumping you to a different place on that line.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 14:33:40+00:00; ;1477649296354861057;en;0;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@turpywurpy Or possibly because that’s what I believe. You’re welcome not to.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 14:33:07+00:00; ;1477649158047551492;en;4;0;2;0;Twitter for iPhone;@stuffysour I agree “order” and “chaos” aren’t the right words
column3: but they are the best I can find for what I mean: the inclination to few versus many. When you’re hyperfocused and can’t move (which is me most of the time)
column4: that’s your brain settling into your monotropism.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 14:31:14+00:00; ;1477648686742130688;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@IzabelaKaramia Yep. I think you’re *born* neurodivergent/monotropic
column3: but environment will be one factor in where you fall on that line.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 14:28:39+00:00; ;1477648034712506369;en;2;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@IzabelaKaramia Yeah
column3: that tracks for the theory tbh. We don’t just move on a daily/hourly basis
column4: but on a lifetime basis. ESP with meds/intervention etc.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 14:27:44+00:00; ;1477647803744768006;en;2;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@LiamODellUK I’ve used two directions to show the two different and opposing forces at play in the monotropic brain. As a monotropic spectrum
column3: yes - that would be another colour wheel.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 14:26:04+00:00; ;1477647383165128704;en;2;0;2;0;Twitter for iPhone;@LiamODellUK No I’m not talking about all neurodivergency. I’m specifically talking about autism and ADHD
column3: and ONLY those two as monotropism
column4: which is essentially one ND that has been divided into two. So it’s the opposite of making it binary - it’s literally saying it’s the same thing.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 13:16:03+00:00; ;1477629763187523584;en;57;1;3;8;Twitter for iPhone;I legit want an entire song of this to go straight to Number One. https://t.co/HSkxLAN69C

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 13:05:22+00:00; ;1477627077029502978;en;3;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@FullAsMuchHeart @AutisticGirls_ It’s all still new territory tbh. Scientists are still working on it. But this seems the most plausible and makes logical sense. It’s essentially how our individual brains handle monotropism
column3: and why the crossover is huge.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 13:01:58+00:00; ;1477626220904857601;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@JoashTaylor @BootstrapCook As long as we can get the meds quickly the official diagnosis can wait.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 13:01:34+00:00; ;1477626120656797706;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@FullAsMuchHeart @AutisticGirls_ Because it’s all monotropism. On one end you have ADHD and on the other is autism. They’re opposites. Some of us fall on one end and get a single diagnosis. Others fall somewhere in between and get a dual diagnosis.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 12:59:41+00:00; ;1477625644452392965;en;0;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@FullAsMuchHeart @AutisticGirls_ Yeah
column3: they’re literally opposites. That’s my point. Same neurology
column4: two different ends.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 12:28:08+00:00; ;1477617706958569475;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@jms5708 Oh good! I feel the same way. X

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 12:27:48+00:00; ;1477617623219249153;en;1;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@AutisticGirls_ @FullAsMuchHeart IMO
column3: it’s because autism and ADHD are two ends of the same neurology. Meds push you further away from the ADHD end towards the autism end.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 11:51:33+00:00; ;1477608498213146625;en;0;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@AEnbyism That won’t be my loved one - they need them all the time
column3: I think.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 11:40:05+00:00; ;1477605613366657026;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@yvescodiashley @TheZooof If the thread is anything to go by
column3: there IS light at the end of the tunnel. Fingers crossed for you. Xx

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 11:34:21+00:00; ;1477604169607520256;en;1;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@kaygrace88 Yes! Super cool right?

column3: ADHD meds -

column1: - It’s trial and error to find the right med/dose

column2: everyone. I feel infinitely more knowledgeable. 🥰 https://t.co/S8rEYbPMgI"

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 11:23:33+00:00; ;1477601453938257921;en;9;0;2;1;Twitter for iPhone;@NinaWadcock That’s not always true. The belief that ND people only struggle because of NTs just isn’t something I agree with. Many NDs have struggles completely outside of it.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 11:22:16+00:00; ;1477601128766492672;en;1;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@yvescodiashley @TheZooof I’m so sorry you feel that way. X

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 11:21:06+00:00; ;1477600835018407939;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@hearts530 @Finnattentive I’m not a scientist but from what I’ve seen - there’s a good chance that’s exactly why. It’s why I’m hoping the meds will work in this instance
column3: as she isn’t autistic.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 11:19:33+00:00; ;1477600447829626883;en;1;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@VickiYoung77 It’s ridiculously hard. 😂 It takes me ages
column3: and I have to lay all the pieces out so I can compare them all. Basically the whole thing is a huge challenge but I want the pretty flowers. 😂

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-02 02:31:29+00:00; ;1477467554541101059;en;0;0;5;0;Twitter for iPhone;@girlggc Yes. Sadly we all do it
column3: whether ABA or not. I didn’t have ABA but I did have the entire world trying to change who I was. It’s exhausting.

column4: and she doesn’t qualify. They’re the same neurology but two expressions
column5: and I fall on one side and she falls on the other.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-01 21:48:54+00:00; ;1477396438862684163;en;2;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@wendyrx @AutisticGirls_ No. She isn’t. And she isn’t my friend - she is my sister
column3: so I know her very well. ADHD and autism are two sides of the same neurology
column4: and we each represent the two extremes. I do not qualify as ADHD and she doesn’t qualify as autistic.

Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-16 17:48:57+00:00; ;1471537847878443008;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@LadyGrimdark @joannanadin I think panic attacks and autistic meltdowns are different
column3: but I’m not the expert. 🥰 I know all humans experience flight or fight
column4: fawn or freeze. Autistic people can just struggle to process emotions which means we do it more?

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-16 17:46:40+00:00; ;1471537275054010381;en;9;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@AutisticCallum_ I do that too

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. column3: and I’ve never seen an NT physically run out of a restaurant in the middle of a conversation. 😂

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-16 17:39:22+00:00; ;1471535436522741764;en;0;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@LadyGrimdark It’s honestly not something I know much about - I think it’s called “elopement”
column3: where you can’t process your emotions so your flight instinct becomes… uncontrollable. I think we all have it
column4: but with NDs it’s normally to avoid a full meltdown.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-16 16:21:42+00:00; ;1471515892580184072;en;0;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@dani_reviews Yup
column3: I have that too. I literally become deaf and black out when I shut down - I can’t even hear or see properly. It’s bloody terrifying.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-16 16:06:59+00:00; ;1471512185801089029;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@kalachelone I agree - I’m ok processing emotions as long as I’m not forced to do it in a NT way (on the spot
column3: no time
column4: weird communication)
column5: which is usually when I run away.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-16 15:54:26+00:00; ;1471509029583142913;en;2;0;2;0;Twitter for iPhone;@AnAutieAtUni @diffusefield Leaving quietly is ideal - it’s when attention is called to it and you’re legging it out the door and falling over things in an effort to get out fast that it becomes “a problem”. 😂

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-16 15:53:41+00:00; ;1471508842051563536;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@kalachelone I think obvs flight is a normal human response
column3: but ability to process emotions more easily means NTs don’t reach the same panic levels as quickly
column4: and thus don’t react the way we can do.

column3: freeze
column4: fawn

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. I’d say for a lot of us it’s heightened. And I’m not talking about actual danger. I am talking about an uncomfortable conversation
column3: or a loud noise. That is not “human normal”.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-16 11:08:52+00:00; ;1471437162952409093;en;1;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@Spontyyy Nope
column3: it’s not neurotypical. We all have fight or flight
column4: but the inability to process emotions to a point where you literally run away
column5: regularly
column6: is not neurotypical.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. column3: and NDs have brains that move towards chaos (ADHD) and order (autism) or wiggle between (both). I fully expect the next decade or so to prove this. I can FEEL it in myself.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-12 13:23:05+00:00; ;1470021389595942913;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@AmandaQuirky Yup. I’m a solo autist - very few ADHD characteristics
column3: unless I’m very tired. Can’t drink coffee past 10am. Everything wires me. My solo ADHD sister can do eight cups a day and still conk out.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-12 13:17:50+00:00; ;1470020067291246595;en;3;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@AmandaQuirky I think you can struggle and still be NT
column3: for a myriad of reasons. Thinking ND is the answer for everyone who isn’t living their best lives right now (which is everyone) trivialises our entire fucking lives.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-12 13:14:05+00:00; ;1470019126076784641;en;3;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@AmandaQuirky I’m not saying they’re the same expression. My sister is ADHD and we are polar opposites. Could not be more different. I’m saying it comes from the same essential base neurology. Meds would help her - they wouldn’t help me.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. column1: I have never known myself more than I do now
column2: or loved myself better. I have never felt more comfortable in my own skin
column3: or confident in my voice. Time is turning me into who I was meant to be
column4: and I am so grateful.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-03 16:32:53+00:00; ;1466807664302858240;en;3;0;0;0;Twitter Web App;@AmandaQuirky @PDArebellion I think there’s an urge to take all those words back. 😂 I agree. Every time I’ve been called “contrary” I’ve been like - no
column3: I just don’t agree with you and social constructs dictate that I should out of politeness. That’s a uou problem
column4: not a me problem. 😂

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-03 16:30:52+00:00; ;1466807156586471427;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter Web App;@HostileHandmaid @AmandaQuirky I think that’s what I meant by “internalising”. (Forgive me
column3: I’m very tired at the moment and not very eloquent.) We don’t just accept norms
column4: we take them on their own merits… and gender is bullshit. Hence we’re like “nah”. 😂

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-03 16:14:15+00:00; ;1466802974081130502;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter Web App;@AmandaQuirky @PDArebellion See
column3: for me the definition of contrariness is doing the opposite of what is expected purely for the sake of it. I don’t see that in myself. I’m happy to tow the line if it’s a line I also agree with. If I don’t
column4: I won’t.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-03 15:53:21+00:00; ;1466797713870184452;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter Web App;@AmandaQuirky @PDArebellion I can’t speak for anyone but me. I just know I’m neither PDA nor actively/passively rejecting a gender norm. I’m being me
column3: exactly as I have been since I was little. It’s society who decides if that fits the shape they expect or not. I’m not just being contrary.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-03 12:50:05+00:00; ;1466751593055928321;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter Web App;@idilsukan @joewellscomic @KieranRose7 @JoanneLimburg Stuff in production but it’s irrelevant - they’re all different stories. None of them ARE “autism shows”. They have characters who happen to be ND and are wildly dissimilar to each other.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-03 12:48:54+00:00; ;1466751296044773389;en;5;0;1;0;Twitter Web App;@JoanneLimburg @idilsukan @joewellscomic @KieranRose7 😂 Exactly. “WE TICKED THAT BOX THANK YOU
column3: DIVERSITY DONE
column4: NOW BUGGER OFF WITH YOUR WEIRD BRAINS.”

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-03 11:41:14+00:00; ;1466734267371823114;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter Web App;@joewellscomic @idilsukan @KieranRose7 @JoanneLimburg Same
column3: although different angle. Also not interested. They “had one” (despite it being completely and utterly the opposite).

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-03 11:28:51+00:00; ;1466731152253853713;en;3;0;0;0;Twitter Web App;@Greg38589422 @drorydress @AmandaQuirky No nothing is the same for all of us
column3: but I think my point is that gender doesn’t exist for anyone. NT
column4: ND
column5: doesn’t matter. It’s about how far we are convinced it does
column6: and perhaps autistic people are more prone to question it.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-03 10:56:38+00:00; ;1466723042466406402;en;3;0;1;0;Twitter Web App;@Greg38589422 @drorydress @AmandaQuirky I just don’t think we lay it down at all
column3: usually. That’s the nature of being autistic
column4: isn’t it? That what everyone else internalises we do not? So if we choose a “gender” we are fully aware it’s a mask and we are performing it.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-03 09:55:15+00:00; ;1466707595645931523;en;9;0;0;0;Twitter Web App;@commaficionado @AmandaQuirky It’s niche but necessary.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-03 09:54:00+00:00; ;1466707278900379652;en;7;0;1;0;Twitter Web App;@commaficionado @AmandaQuirky EXACTLY. I was trying to remember which optical illusion I was thinking of and that’s the one!

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-03 09:53:28+00:00; ;1466707146729562113;en;7;0;0;0;Twitter Web App;"@drorydress @AmandaQuirky Yeah that’s what I’m saying. It’s the qualities that oppose our expected “genders” that are noticed. My insane love of animals goes unnoticed because it’s feminine; my direct speech does not."

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-03 09:50:19+00:00; ;1466706352814895104;en;3;0;1;0;Twitter Web App;@drorydress @AmandaQuirky Yes
column3: and so you could argue that’s why autistic men can seem “feminine” and women can seem “masculine” - because different qualities are focused on. They’re all the same qualities.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-03 09:46:35+00:00; ;1466705412967870464;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter Web App;@AmandaQuirky Yes
column3: but it’s still a performance. And I’d argue that the essence of being autistic is not internalising what the rest of the world internalises. So it makes sense that we don’t internalise gender either.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-03 09:39:39+00:00; ;1466703670796591104;en;10;0;2;0;Twitter Web App;@AmandaQuirky Also
column3: I’d argue that because we can be very similar (Kieran and I are similar
column4: IMO) what reads as “feminine” in a man reads as “masculine” in a woman even though they’re the same (neutral and genderless) qualities. It’s the lens that changes
column5: not the subject.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-03 09:33:55+00:00; ;1466702227523964934;en;4;0;1;0;Twitter Web App;@AmandaQuirky But even if you take away gender as a performance (which it is)
column3: autistic neurology is gendered
column4: no? Directness
column5: logic
column6: lack of obvious emotion
column7: brutal honesty - it’s all perceived as (the made up concept of) “masculine”.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-03 09:32:29+00:00; ;1466701867581333510;en;1;0;1;0;Twitter Web App;@AmandaQuirky But that’s what I mean - gender doesn’t exist
column3: so it’s totally irrelevant to me if I’m seen as “feminine” or not. I am as I am
column4: actively. Also autistic qualities in women are generally seen as “masculine” anyway.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-03 09:25:22+00:00; ;1466700074642296839;en;12;0;3;0;Twitter Web App;@AmandaQuirky I don’t think it’s PDA - gender is a performance
column3: and we simply don’t perform (or feel the need to).

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-03 08:58:56+00:00; ;1466693420727033858;en;4;0;0;0;Twitter Web App;@KieranRose7 @AmandaQuirky @commaficionado @idilsukan @autisticlyaaron @JoanneLimburg Don’t be daft
column3: friendly debate is MY LIFE BLOOD and I enjoy every moment of it. Thank you for giving us all chance to discuss!!! 🥰🥰

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-03 08:51:48+00:00; ;1466691626231869440;en;4;0;0;0;Twitter Web App;@KieranRose7 @commaficionado @idilsukan @autisticlyaaron @JoanneLimburg Ah but I got to see your lovely face 12 times! 🥰

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-03 08:50:17+00:00; ;1466691245955235845;en;2;0;2;0;Twitter Web App;@AmandaQuirky @KieranRose7 @commaficionado @idilsukan @autisticlyaaron @JoanneLimburg Yes. And that’s a good example of how both are important. You cannot break open the narrative without exploring alternatives.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-03 08:48:22+00:00; ;1466690764822482948;en;3;0;0;0;Twitter Web App;@KieranRose7 @commaficionado @idilsukan @autisticlyaaron @JoanneLimburg As an artist
column3: I will never agree that individual stories need to be eradicated. That’s what art is. It is the fabric of society and it matters. Every subculture on earth explores their way of being through stories. You can be collective and individual.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-03 08:42:22+00:00; ;1466689253094694915;en;3;0;1;0;Twitter Web App;@AmandaQuirky @KieranRose7 @commaficionado @idilsukan @autisticlyaaron @JoanneLimburg I think so too. 😂 We’re both making the same point but coming in at different angles.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-03 08:41:34+00:00; ;1466689053118636033;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter Web App;@KieranRose7 @commaficionado @idilsukan @autisticlyaaron @JoanneLimburg We are definitely talking at odds. 😂 Yes
column3: of course the weight of our collective stories matter
column4: and we have a responsibility to make sure they are diverse. I’m simply saying that a choir is individual voices - the power comes from singing from the same hymn sheet. 🥰

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-03 08:39:34+00:00; ;1466688547063226374;en;2;0;0;0;Twitter Web App;@KieranRose7 @commaficionado @idilsukan @autisticlyaaron @JoanneLimburg All of that is essential
column3: Kieran
column4: and you do a spectacular job. I agree that newly diagnosed autists lack that knowledge and sometimes don’t do due diligence. It is the framework from which our separate voices speak.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-03 08:37:26+00:00; ;1466688014210510848;en;4;0;1;0;Twitter Web App;@KieranRose7 @commaficionado @idilsukan @autisticlyaaron @JoanneLimburg I think we might be talking at cross purposes (shocking for two autists 😂). I would never ever argue against intersectionality and fighting for us all
column3: in our diverse entirety. But our individual stories are part of that
column4: ESPECIALLY when they change the narrative.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-03 08:35:45+00:00; ;1466687588647976963;en;5;0;0;0;Twitter Web App;@KieranRose7 @commaficionado @idilsukan @autisticlyaaron @JoanneLimburg I absolutely agree
column3: and it’s important to be inclusive and also study autism as a whole and a community (which you do so brilliantly). But when it comes to art
column4: music
column5: books - those are individual expressions and they are also essential. We can be both separate and together.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-03 01:27:10+00:00; ;1466579731575312385;en;2;0;0;0;Twitter Web App;@idilsukan @NDNeuroNews @commaficionado @liveotherwise @KieranRose7 @autisticlyaaron @JoanneLimburg Absolutely. And our stories are not for NDs - they are for everyone
column3: just as we are all enriched by learning more about those who are not us.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-03 01:07:50+00:00; ;1466574867751395334;en;3;0;2;0;Twitter Web App;@idilsukan @NDNeuroNews @commaficionado @liveotherwise @KieranRose7 @autisticlyaaron @JoanneLimburg The need to get it “right” or “perfect” or “representative of everyone” inhibits expression
column3: art
column4: creativity - all the things we need and are entitled to
column5: along with all other humans. An omelette is still made by cracking separate eggs.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-03 00:58:20+00:00; ;1466572474775072768;en;26;0;2;0;Twitter Web App;@commaficionado @KieranRose7 @idilsukan @autisticlyaaron @JoanneLimburg Don’t be - there is no “wrong”. There is your autistic experience
column3: and others will find comfort and solace in that
column4: just as we all do in the stories of others like us. NTs get billions of the buggers
column5: so why should we be a faceless monolith?

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-03 00:55:00+00:00; ;1466571635457155076;en;9;0;1;1;Twitter Web App;@commaficionado @liveotherwise @KieranRose7 @idilsukan @autisticlyaaron @JoanneLimburg Nobody can ever claim to have the definitive autistic experience
column3: because there isn’t one - that’s the point. We need those individual stories
column4: fictional or fact. No society can exist without them
column5: and we shouldn’t be excluded from the human narrative.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-03 00:42:47+00:00; ;1466568561795624960;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter Web App;@idilsukan @KieranRose7 @autisticlyaaron @JoanneLimburg Exactly. I just think for things to change you need both the group power and you need the individual stories
column3: as diverse as possible. Humans do not respond to concepts. We respond to other humans.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-03 00:36:38+00:00; ;1466567014906875907;en;0;0;1;0;Twitter Web App;@idilsukan @KieranRose7 @autisticlyaaron @JoanneLimburg Yes. And conversely we need to know it’s okay to BE alone. A lot of us are not naturally social creatures. And that’s okay. Which is why there’s value in the diversity of our experiences and ways of being.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-03 00:34:36+00:00; ;1466566502052630530;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter Web App;@idilsukan @raelee514 @KieranRose7 @autisticlyaaron @JoanneLimburg Yes of course. As with any subculture
column3: both the snowstorm and the snowflakes matter. We need both.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-03 00:33:21+00:00; ;1466566186615730177;en;7;0;1;0;Twitter Web App;@KieranRose7 @idilsukan @autisticlyaaron @JoanneLimburg No but that’s my point - we need both. We need those who educate about autism as a whole and those who individualise the experience. Autism is not unique in that - it goes for all subcultures.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-03 00:32:08+00:00; ;1466565883485167618;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter Web App;@KieranRose7 @idilsukan @autisticlyaaron @JoanneLimburg I agree we need balance. We need both individual and collective stories
column3: just as any minority does. I don’t think there can be any movement forward without both. As a monolith and as separate entities within that. An educational course isn’t the same as a fiction book.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-02 23:38:20+00:00; ;1466552345056133124;en;18;0;4;0;Twitter Web App;@idilsukan @KieranRose7 @autisticlyaaron @JoanneLimburg The entire point of intersectionality is that nobody is experiencing life (or autism) the same way. And the most powerful way to illustrate that is to open the floor to all of those individual experiences.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-02 23:30:20+00:00; ;1466550329961598976;en;16;0;4;0;Twitter Web App;@KieranRose7 @autisticlyaaron @idilsukan @JoanneLimburg I don’t agree with this. We exist independently
column3: and I think that individual stories matter too. Art has always been one of the strongest forms of encouraging empathy and compassion
column4: and it’s a chorus of separate voices.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-02 22:17:44+00:00; ;1466532057891409920;en;3;0;0;0;Twitter Web App;@idilsukan @KieranRose7 @JoanneLimburg I can’t imagine any autistic person hasn’t felt the same.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-02 22:07:52+00:00; ;1466529574993473538;en;4;0;1;0;Twitter Web App;@idilsukan @KieranRose7 @JoanneLimburg I agree
column3: but I hope that’s changing little by little. I think the more a diversity of us speak and create
column4: the faster we will break down those stereotypes. (I’m in the minority in loving Sheldon
column5: I think.)

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-02 22:06:04+00:00; ;1466529123279327233;en;2;0;2;0;Twitter Web App;@idilsukan @JoanneLimburg @KieranRose7 I also don’t know if Melanie only just found out - I am going to assume she only just went public. There’s usually a big gap
column3: and I’m pretty sure she’s done a documentary about it already.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-02 22:03:56+00:00; ;1466528586819465218;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter Web App;@idilsukan @JoanneLimburg @KieranRose7 I think things are changing. They really are. But not necessarily with the  speed or in the direction we’d ideally like. But as I said
column3: I’m not a TV person - it’s not my skill set
column4: really. But the world is listening more
column5: I think.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-02 22:01:09+00:00; ;1466527885687070720;en;3;0;1;0;Twitter Web App;@idilsukan @KieranRose7 @JoanneLimburg In short - yes. But I’m not a tv person which is fair enough
column3: but how else do we change the narrative?

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-02 22:00:07+00:00; ;1466527626953211909;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter Web App;@led_zeppo It’s a zucchini in most countries. 😂

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-02 19:29:07+00:00; ;1466489626252746758;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter Web App;@AmandaQuirky @kim_crawley I can’t be bothered either. 😂

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-02 19:20:17+00:00; ;1466487401191247881;en;1;0;1;0;Twitter Web App;@AmandaQuirky @kim_crawley I don’t think that’s quite what’s going on here but I could be wrong. 😂 I’m so sorry you went through that though. Xxx

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-02 19:15:43+00:00; ;1466486252379725829;en;3;0;1;0;Twitter Web App;@AmandaQuirky @kim_crawley Did you sign up to a documentary focusing on their autism though? And go through the physical process of signing away their rights? (Which you have to
column3: legally.) And then not tell them? And profit from it instead? It doesn’t seem the same thing to me.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-12-02 19:09:08+00:00; ;1466484598242783244;en;42;0;1;0;Twitter Web App;@KieranRose7 @JoanneLimburg I can say with authority: they’ve tried
column3: and been rejected. Perpetuating the narrative is the only priority for the people with the power
column4: because it serves them.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. column3: and everyone knows who they are and what their neurology is before they do.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-11-23 11:23:01+00:00; ;1463105802034688000;en;32;0;0;3;Twitter Web App;"Popping back from my social media holiday (which is lovely
column3: thank you for asking) to say that @booknookhove are still taking Xmas orders for my signed books!

column1: Get in by next Thursday and I’ll sign and dedicate anything to anyone. I’m not proud. 🥰

column3: so I’m stepping away from online activity for a few weeks to take care of myself. See you all in December. 💕

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-11-15 16:24:35+00:00; ;1460282594772279296;en;3;0;1;0;Twitter Web App;@MrsNickyClark Exactly. But hey - learning curves are good
column3: right?

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-11-15 16:23:34+00:00; ;1460282336793219074;en;6;0;1;1;Twitter Web App;@CorvidAdvocate Essentially I *have* disclosed at work
column3: given that this is my job. So yeah - no need for it.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-11-15 16:22:50+00:00; ;1460282154026471426;en;2;0;0;0;Twitter Web App;@karamina It is too much. It triggers
column3: over and over again and it’s not good for our mental health.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-11-15 16:22:18+00:00; ;1460282016113569793;en;21;0;0;1;Twitter Web App;@BooksandChokers Yeah
column3: I’m done. We shouldn’t have to do this. Neurodiversity in literature is one thing
column4: because we’re writers. But tell us about that thing you’re still seeing a therapist about? Fuck off. No more.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-11-15 16:13:14+00:00; ;1460279738400915462;en;15;0;1;1;Twitter Web App;@ElliePursey @taperoo2k Yes it happens in real life too. “But you can’t be autistic because” so you try and prove it by outlining the pain and trauma you’ve been through. I think we need to say when it is enough.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-11-15 15:14:21+00:00; ;1460264917077012493;en;1;0;1;0;Twitter Web App;@LauraFMcConnell Thank you so much!

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-11-15 14:56:32+00:00; ;1460260433361788928;en;2;0;0;0;Twitter Web App;@AmandaPCraig @BooksandChokers Thank you. I agree. I really meant I’m not interested in the constant sharing of my personal life. I think we can advocate and write about neurodivergence without doing that.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-11-15 14:49:16+00:00; ;1460258605794578440;en;9;0;0;0;Twitter Web App;@GeoffHarrow I am glad it has helped. But I’m drawing a line now. I can’t keep reliving my trauma - it’s going to mean I can never move on. X

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-11-15 14:48:25+00:00; ;1460258390391803908;en;6;0;1;0;Twitter Web App;@AmandaPCraig Absolutely. I just want to write. I have no interest in the rest of it. X

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-11-15 14:35:59+00:00; ;1460255264200925197;en;30;0;0;2;Twitter Web App;@Joannechocolat It should. But celebrity culture infiltrating every single art form has made people forget that there’s a difference between who we are and what we make.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-11-15 14:25:32+00:00; ;1460252634212970497;en;35;1;0;1;Twitter Web App;@dynazoar So true. Or that we can’t be autistic if we’re NOT suffering. Like - “oh so you’ve done well but come on
column3: tell us about the bits that fucked you up”.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-11-15 14:19:44+00:00; ;1460251172078510083;en;58;0;3;1;Twitter Web App;@taperoo2k I’ve felt a need to “prove” I’m autistic by talking about really upsetting stuff
column3: and I refuse to do it anymore.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-11-15 14:18:19+00:00; ;1460250817538183170;en;32;0;1;1;Twitter Web App;@MichelleFirth17 😘 I’m more than happy to continue advocating for autistic people. But I don’t need to talk about the details of my trauma to do that. We have to protect ourselves. Xx

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-11-15 14:16:46+00:00; ;1460250428084572162;en;407;1;10;16;Twitter Web App;"I originally shared so that others wouldn’t feel so alone. But it’s become a “tell us how they hurt you” show and I’m not doing it anymore.

column1: I’m autistic. I don’t have to prove it
column2: or justify it
column3: or cut myself open to make others feel better.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-11-15 14:12:12+00:00; ;1460249277360492545;en;1516;11;42;96;Twitter Web App;"I’m done with sharing my trauma with the world.

column1: Every time I speak to the media they want to know the nitty gritty of my past
column2: essentially to “prove” that I’m autistic because I struggled. It’s trauma porn and I’m not doing it anymore.

column1: The world is not entitled to our pain."

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-11-15 14:08:26+00:00; ;1460248330563371018;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter Web App;@SearlsDiane @SueReviews Yes
column3: I thought they’d edit that out. Which is worse. He interrupted to ask me to get to the point and it was one of many micro-aggressions that made me emotional and unable to cohesively hold my argument. I got off the phone and cried.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-11-15 13:51:52+00:00; ;1460244158522830856;en;3;0;1;0;Twitter Web App;@SearlsDiane @SueReviews That’s why I’m not listening - I knew they were doing that. I could tell. I don’t know if they included it but at one point he asked me to “get to the point” while I was talking. It was rude
column3: patronising and frankly the worst interview I’ve ever done. In a decade of them.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-11-15 12:52:31+00:00; ;1460229225466810374;en;3;0;1;0;Twitter Web App;@SueReviews Oh no
column3: of course not! I just won’t be listening. But thank you for tagging me. X

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-11-15 12:15:29+00:00; ;1460219904712482825;en;3;0;3;0;Twitter Web App;@SueReviews I found David really rude and upsetting so I wonder if that came across. I’m not going to listen to it. Thanks though.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-11-15 12:01:32+00:00; ;1460216393513803776;en;4;0;1;0;Twitter Web App;@LauraFMcConnell @Kathy_Bramley It’s a euphemism
column3: it’s infantilising
column4: inaccurate
column5: unnecessary and not up to NTs to use. Just like any euphemism about a minority outside that minority community.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-11-15 11:59:16+00:00; ;1460215822006247427;en;3;0;2;0;Twitter Web App;@SueReviews I can’t bring myself to listen - it was an awful interview. Is it okay?

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-11-15 05:47:50+00:00; ;1460122349785829378;en;6;0;0;0;Twitter Web App;@mattkeflowers Don’t apologise! I should have been clearer
column3: but it was within the context of an earlier discussion. Generally when NTs describe people as “probably on the spectrum” it means “weird”.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-11-15 05:46:11+00:00; ;1460121932557438977;en;4;0;0;0;Twitter Web App;@ToGreeks @theJeremyVine False equivalence. It’s a euphemism. If you want to refer to yourself with a euphemism
column3: that’s fine. But don’t refer to a minority with a euphemism when you are not part of it. Rule of thumb for all minorities.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-11-15 05:43:10+00:00; ;1460121175405862926;en;9;0;1;0;Twitter Web App;@mattkeflowers You misunderstood my tweet. People asking “are you on the spectrum?” is never a question from a person interested in autism. It’s an insult - a way of saying “are you broken?”

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-11-15 05:40:05+00:00; ;1460120399837081605;en;5;0;1;0;Twitter Web App;@mattkeflowers Good for you.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-11-15 05:39:27+00:00; ;1460120241682497537;en;3;0;0;0;Twitter Web App;@TweetleMcBeetle @Davedoingideas @AlexCaHansen @theJeremyVine Neurodiversity is literally everyone on the planet. It’s a word to describe diversity of neurology.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-11-15 05:38:26+00:00; ;1460119983330054148;en;2;0;0;0;Twitter Web App;@JamesGr4y @KirstyLouiseMo1 @theJeremyVine It’s a euphemism. The official name is Autism Spectrum Disorder - not “on the spectrum”. Conflating the two is ridiculous. You don’t get to choose the euphemisms you call a minority. It makes you an arsehole.

award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-11-15 01:40:16+00:00; ;1460060048252715016;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter Web App;@docteurshepherd No
column3: it’s more complex than that. It’s partly trauma but it’s also the black and white way our brains work. Good/bad. In my life/out my life.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-11-15 01:37:56+00:00; ;1460059458399313925;en;5;0;1;0;Twitter Web App;@docteurshepherd Yeah it is. We’re the kings and queens of bridge burning.

column3: ever regretted a burnt bridge. There’s an assumption it’s an illogical emotional decision
column4: but I carefully weigh it up before I do it. I only burn it when I’ve decided it can’t be rebuilt.

column1: B) it implies that “the spectrum” is linear from mild to severe - which it isn’t - and is used by NTs to argue “we are all on it somewhere” when we are not."

column3: and it’s caused by comorbidities

Yes
column3: it is though. You’re autistic or not. And the NAS don’t refer to “on the spectrum” now either. It is a way of avoiding the word “autism” and also implies a linear spectrum.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-11-14 14:30:15+00:00; ;1459891431116623875;en;21;0;1;0;Twitter Web App;"@JamesGr4y @theJeremyVine Wow

column1: I know what the spectrum is. A) it’s a way of not saying “autistic” because it is seen as negative and B) it implies a linear spectrum from mild to severe
column2: which is not what autism is."

column3: not of measuring your functionality.

column2: award-winning author of GEEK GIRL and THE VALENTINES. Autistic and dyspraxic activist. 🌈💓🧝🏻‍♀️ Agent:@KateJShaw;56673;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-11-04 20:32:30+00:00; ;1456358716027064327;en;1;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@TrishLeonardACT @isntJen That’s what I’m hoping
